text:
e="preserve">Kevin Thomas Duffy (January 10, 1933 – April 1, 2020) was an American lawyer and politician. He was a United States District Judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York from 1972 to 1998 after being nominated by President Richard Nixon. Duffy was born in New York City.
Duffy died from problems caused by COVID-19 at a hospital in Greenwich, Connecticut on April 1, 2020, at age 87.

annotations.surface_form: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
